bug.author: mzahran001
bug.description: I am trying to save Lidar data using the method save_to_disk in the automatic_control.py but I think that the lidar is saved upside down. I am using MeshLab to visualize the lidar. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15180702/52922164-a49cee80-3327-11e9-814d-5d97dc2243e8.gif></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: I also noticed this, this has always been like this with our Lidar. I always wondered if this is a bug or a problem with the default axis visualization in meshlab.

Hi, @moh3th1 Could you please show how to use save_to_disk function in the python script to save raw data for Lidar sensor? I tried this line: lidar.listen(lambda image: image.save_to_disk('_lidarout')) but it came out with this warning:
sensor object went out of the scope but the sensor is still alive in the simulation.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tatttto>@tatttto</denchmark-link> To save lidar point clouds you have to use this: self.sensor.listen(lambda LidarMeasurement: LidarMeasurement.save_to_disk('_out/%06d.ply' % LidarMeasurement.frame_number))
